title: 112_hr2553
content: The "Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2011, Part IV" extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 16, 2011. Additionally, the Act extends the expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 17, 2011. The Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2011, Part IV extends funding for the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 16, 2011. It also extends the expenditure authority of the Trust Fund until September 17, 2011. Additionally, the Act authorizes appropriations of $3,380,178,082 for the period from October 1, 2010, to September 16, 2011, with funds remaining available until expended. The Airport and Airway Extension Act of 2011 extends various expiring authorities until December 31, 2011, by amending different sections of title 49, United States Code. Section 49108, 161, and 186(d) of the Vision 100--Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act are amended to change dates. The amendments will be effective on July 23, 2011. Section 41731(a)(1) of title 49, United States Code, is amended for Essential Air Service Reform. Section 41731 of title 49, United States Code is amended to include new criteria for determining eligible places for Essential Air Service. Exceptions are made for locations in Alaska. Exceptions for Locations in Alaska are made by adding subsections (c) and (d) to Section 41731 of title 49, United States Code. Subsection (c) states that certain provisions shall not apply to locations in Alaska, while subsection (d) allows the Secretary to waive certain requirements for locations with difficult access to airports.
